item.description:
I do this every year, in fact I love waiting until it's cold and there is snow on the ground (although we barely had any last year!) There is something beautiful about the beach and ocean with the snow. The sand dunes are a great hike and yes we are allowed on them! $7 fee per car to get in..We hike for about 2 hours and then head to out for food and drinks after (TBA)

 

What to wear - WARM clothes. Ski jacket or windbreaker. Ski pants are good or something lined. It is VERY windy, especially in January, so dress accordingly. Definitely recommend a hat, scarf, gloves, etc.

For feet - sneakers are fine, but recommend winter boots or hiking boots.

 

We will start promptly at 12:00 noon. There will be three different hikes of varying distances. We will all finish hiking by 2:00 pm and head over the Ipswich Sports Bar, which is located at 24 Hammatt St in the center of town.

http://www.ipswichsportsbar.com/

 

CARPOOLING:

Please let me know ASAP if you need a ride and I will get together a carpooling list. If you are willing to drive from the Boston area, please let me know as well.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the parking lot at the entrance to the dunes. I will wait a few extra minutes in case anyone is late.
item.name: Winter Sand Dune Hiking at Crane's Beach (Ipswich) & Ipswich Sports Bar
